page.title: 13The Pottery.
page.content: The Mill Pottery is situated on the outskirts of Wooton Courtenay. In Domesday Book a mill is mentioned at the same place. The last person to use it as a mill was a milleress. When Mr. Gaitskell moved in, on October 4th 1974, it was a run-down farm Mr. Gaitskell is mostly self-taught but is very skilled at his work. He produces a selection of stone-ware ranging from egg-cups to bread bins. Most of his items are for house-hold use but some are decorative. He makes glazes called Chun, Temmoku and Dolomite.Since he came Mr. Gaitskell has installed a fibreglass, 9 foot water-wheel which produces 5 horsepower. He hopes to drive the clay-mixer, ballmill and pugmill on water power. He's hoping that in the future when people come, they will be able to see the whole process.
